I came back because the stay was fantastic! I and my daughter enjoyed it for many days. I'm a stickler for quietness and peace. I had an amazing Stay! I will recommend to anyone traveling here to Little Rock. They generally give you everything you may need and better than a hotel. Yasssss!! This place will not disappoint you if your seeking. The skyline out the windows is my favorite because I love trees and loved ðŸ‘€ seeing the Monarch land on the window as I cooked. Being able to cook, and have essentials like pots, pans, access to a refrigerator, most of all a coffee pot makes all the difference in the world for awaking early morning. Being able to open the kitchen window in Apt #4, was truly unique. I love hearing outside noise and it was my highlight. I'll book it any day over a hotel if your a more reserved person. I am!
Best,
Kanisha

,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
I enjoyed it so much, I felt like I was visiting a family member's home. Private, Peaceful and very chill. I and my daughter both familiar with the neighborhood because I once lived at 1400 Cumberland location over a year ago for 5 years, so I wanted to stay close to SOMA which is why I wanted a downtown location to relax in before I move back downtown area permanently again soon. Stephanie and Jason's place gave me those memories of living back downtown again. I grew up on Rock street 1 street over and have lived in downtown most of my entire life, and I felt right at home at this residence. I miss it so much being close to nearby restaurants, convenient grocery stores, and the entertainment district especially the Bernice Gardens, and my favorite Pizzeria Rad Uno. Thank you all for the experience and I look forward to lodging again. Never a dull moment living in downtown Little Rock, Arkansas.
Best,
Kanisha and Scarlet

Â·
Stayed one night
review_text: A very quiet, safe and walkable place to stay, but know it is not the most updated home. However, it has what you need for a clean and cozy stay - plenty of fresh towels, good water pressure in shower, comfortable bed, cooking amenities, shampoo/conditioner, soap, lotion, tissues, etc. It's a great place to stay for a few nights for one or 2 people as it is a tight space. As mentioned, it is an older home so quiet guests are best as you don't want to be hearing other conversations, music, etc. from the other rooms. I will say the wifi didn't work great for the smart TV at night but that isn't a big deal if you don't plan to stay in the apartment most days. No drinking water provided, but luckily I had brought my own. There was also no dish soap to wash the few dirty dishes I had (hope that wasn't a pain on my hosts!). I really liked the place overall and felt right at home. I would stay here again for sure!

review_text: This was a perfect place to stay for a single person or couple- lots of restaurants nearby as well as a lovely dog park. The outdoor area was such a nice tough being fully fenced in and having seating as well as a picnic table to make eating pleasant since the inside is more setup like a modern hotel room. Everything is exactly as described and Dero was responsive and helpful. They even had dog bowls and dog treats ready- my little dog had a great time in the yard as well as the nearby dog park. The bed was extremely comfortable and the tv was easy to use with access to streaming services. They even had some provided bottled waters and coffee pods- I cannot imagine a more perfect place to stay for short trips. I wish we had more time to explore the area, this was a stop in the middle of an out of state move so we were only there briefly but I confidently recommend this for anyone needing a short but very comfortable stay in the area.

Stayed one night
review_text: Best airbnb I've stayed in. The hosts have thought of everything and all the small things really added up. There were condiments in the fridge, a small bowl of welcome snacks, to-go cups for morning coffee, single-use eye masks/ear plugs, robes in the closet, the electrical sockets next to the bed had usb, etc. The decor was coherent and i really liked the styling. The proportions of the house were also great considering its a tiny home: spacious walk-in shower with double vanity in the bathroom, good-size comfy bed, and some space to eat/lounge. Hosts were very responsive and there wasnt a massive list of check-out responsibilities (hate when theres a whole to-do list for check-out). Absolutely worth the price! Would stay again!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Christinaâ€™s place was exactly what I needed for two relaxing days in Little Rock.
Decor: perfect. I love the green tiles, and everything from the shower water pressure to the thermostat to the bed linens was very thoughtful and well executed.
Logistics: check in and out was a breeze, and the hosts were super communicative and gave great neighborhood tips! I especially liked strolling down Main Street in the SoMa area. South on Main and the Root were my favorites! (I went to the root 3x in 2 days - great food and coffee).
Location: I rented a car and found the location ideal for everything I wanted to see and do. I walked a lot too, and found the neighborhood surprisingly walkable and very friendly.
In all, a wonderful stay and I would happily visit again. I felt very at home for my 48 hours in Little Rock!

name: Lindsay

,

June 2023
,
Â·
Stayed with a pet
review_text:
Had a lovely one night stay at James'. It is just enough space for one or two people, plus they allow pets. The home was so clean and is well-finished.
Check in was effortless and James had left us cold waters, snacks, and ice in the freezer. We didn't cook, but the kitchen has a full-sized stove and all the things you may need to make a meal if you so choose. There is street parking right in front of the house, so it's just a short walk to the front door with your luggage.
The yard isn't overly large, but plenty of space for a dog to run around since it is fully fenced. The back has berries growing and a small garden and chickens, which is fun. No roosters, so no need to worry about crowing.
The home is a short drive to many restaurants, bars, etc. and was easy to find with GPS. We enjoyed Bruno's. Great Italian! And ice cream from Loblolly.
Would highly recommend this rental for anyone needing a smaller space that has all you need in Little Rock.
James was also quick to respond :)

The pool area has it's own heat/air unit which allowed us to adjust to a comfortable temperature. The pool water stayed between 80-85 degrees & felt great! Everything from extra towels to crock pots were available. Plenty of toiletries & laundry pods. The host Dana was absolutely amazing! She greeted us upon arrival to give us information & instructions for the property. She was available to contact with any questions & very quick to respond. This place made one of the best and most memorable times for us! We will definitely be back!

This house is uniquely awesome & was just perfect for our group of 11!! Having an indoor pool (with a fun slide) in the middle of the house is super neat! The 3 bedrooms are spacious & comfortable, very large master suite king bed, the two bunks are twin over full which was great, and the other room has two full beds. Beds & decor very nice. Everything is fresh & new, super soft towels, convenient laundry room by the bath & bedrooms. Welcome cookies & a bottle of wine were appreciated.
While the pool being located between the bedrooms and the rest of the house (living, kitchen, & dining) worked great for us, the pool is just steps from each side of the house, so young children who don't
swim would need to be watched carefully, obviously.
Dana's place was a house
like no other & we

much!!
We hope to stay again.

review_text:
We can't stop talking about this amazing place. It was an unforgettable experience. It was so charming and relaxing that we didn't even go anywhere the first night. Just sat on the deck and on the dock, and watched the world go by and the sun set. Barges, blue herons, Canadian geese, little fish jumping up to eat, funny sounding birds, relaxing waves hitting the side of the boat-all so enchanting.
The interior decorating was beautiful, the attention to the small details that travelers are often looking for was over the top excellent, and all of the furnishings were warm and inviting. It did not feel like a small space at all. We loved our stay.

The gate leading to the boat dock stays locked. An Access code is given prior to check in. The River is calm and gentle, therefore we did not feel any quesiness. This is a one of a kind, must-stay place. Trust me, you'll want to go back.

review_text: The place was exactly as pictured and described. It was perfect for my wife and I. It was in a new living community. it felt as though the neighborhood was very safe. It is right next to the River Trail which runs a great distance down the side if the river. The only issue I had was the ramp down to the marina was very steep. I'm not sure if it is like this all the time or if the river was low (obviously not the hosts fault, but be prepared). Check in was a breeze. The bed was very comfortable. The barges would make a wake and it would rock ever so gently. The back porch was amazing and was absolutely great at night to relax and look at the city skyline, and for having breakfast in the morning. Only regret is not having a couple of more days to spend there.

This Airbnb rental will be my top choice for anyone traveling to the area for a solo or couple getaway. I would absolutely book Myrandaâ€™s accommodations over any hotel. The privacy & peaceful energy of the houseboat is unmatched. She did an amazing job with the beautiful aesthetics even with the limited space.
The back patio area with the astonishing view is where you will spend most mornings and nights, especially with the special touch of binoculars supplied by the host. From the exceptional communication after booking to the special snack basket you will not go wrong in booking this space.
Mark my world, this houseboat will be a top rental! I foresee many people traveling for the experience & those locally even selecting the rental for a staycation. There is nothing not to love, itâ€™s truly a beautiful home away from home.
Thank you Myranda for the amazing experience, you are sitting on a gem!â¤ï¸

review_text: We loved everything about the lodge, it was even prettier than the pictures! Beautiful, clean accommodations, and surroundings. Dena provided extra amenities like fresh flowers, and Christmas decor that made us feel right at home! The lodge had nice, comfy beds, and furniture with extra cozy blankets and lots of room for our big family. We loved the pellet fireplace, and game table along with the outside deck with a hammock which was great for drinking coffee and watching the sunrise, so peaceful. The 2 kitchens were awesome with very nice cookware, coffee pots etc. just everything you may need! Having 3 beautiful bathrooms with plenty of supplies and toiletries was wonderful. When we needed anything, Dena was quick to attend to our needs. We hope to stay again at we now call our Christmas Lodge.

review_text: This is my home-away-from-home. I stay here regularly and have been doing so for over two years. Things I like about the Craftsman: (1) big comfy bed, (2) big closet with good wood hangars (those are hard to come by in most Airbnb's), (3) everything works - the stove, microwave, TV, coffee, washer/dryer - and they work every time I'm there, (4) the front porch (another thing that many similar places lack), (5) good linens and towels, and (6) Angela and her team are always available and helpful. This place is easy to "highly recommend". Two thumbs up for the Historic Craftsman!

review_text: We have stayed once before at Angela's AirBnb. Not only was she quickly responsive to requests, she followed up to make certain that everything was good. As an example I had to ask for her to reprogram the mini-split HVAC to provide heat when the weather suddenly turned much cooler than it had been when we arrived. She did this promptly and asked permission to enter the AirBnB while we were away in order to accomplish this. Then she followed up with a message to make certain that the heat was working and that we were comfortable again. This place was immaculate. We have tried to stay other times but found the unit was occupied on the dates we wanted, so we were really pleased to get this on our recent visit. We will stay again.

Stayed one night
review_text:
This was our first AirBnB experience so we were nervous at first but Angela made it a blast! She was responsive and friendly with any questions or concerns we had.
Checking in was simple and the location was great. We felt safe and were surprised we were a close distance to the historic Central High School. Angela also offers great suggestions to local restaurants in a helpful guidebook.
The place itself is a beautiful restoration of Craftsman style houses. We were shocked when we walked in, so if you're a fan of the design like my daughter is you'll love it. The wifi is also fast with a nice roku tv.
Aesthetics aside it was very clean and well stocked. You truly felt comfortable in the space. Dishes, pots, and a gas stove were available to make your own meals. There was also complimentary coffee, tea, and snacks. The bathroom was realxing and the bed was comfortable after a long day of driving.
We wish we could give it more than 5 stars, will visit if we stop in AK again! :)

review_text: I stay here on a weekly and since I do a review every week I sometimes get a little lax due to the fact that the review is essentially the same every week - it's a great place to stay. Besides being clean and comfortable the Historic Craftsman has several features that are noteworthy. The closet is big and is well stocked with good wooden hangars - you just don't find that in very many places. The shower is roomy, water pressure is fine, and it's low-entry, which is good for me and my gamey knee! All the appliances are modern and they all work - again, that's not always the case elsewhere. There is a nice front porch to sit on; this is really nice and helps you feel more "at home"; I've often had a little snack out there after a long day of work. Angela even has "to-go" coffee cups so that you can take coffee with you when you check out and get back on the road home. Speaking of Angela - she and her crew do a great job of maintaining the place and communicating with guests!

The next time we are headed to Memphis/Millington we will probably choose to fly into Little Rock. We visited 2 (of the 52!!!) State Parks and rode the trolley. We also visited Hot Springs National Park... hindsight we should have stayed all 3 nights in this house not one day in a Hot Springs airbnb. Definitely worth the commute back and forth to Hot Springs to be able to stay in such a comfortable place. Thank you, Angela!
